data.text: @billisdoing @RichardfromSyd1 And 12-15 year olds need boosters as latest data shows protection against moderate disease almost non-existent after 5 months. We need boosters esp in time for winter for all (preferably with Omicron-specific elements added to protect against both Delta & Omicron).

@RichardfromSyd1 @AugersMonster @RageSheen Yes, it certainly does, 1st thing I did after seeing Wuhan videos was research previous pandemics. It helped me, but most people I know thought I was exaggerating when I said COVID wouldn’t be over in a few months. So I’m knowledgeable & pissed off as predictable events occur.

@RichardfromSyd1 Dunno about the Prof, but generally, I couldn't give a rat's arse about whether transmission to me might come from a "community" or a "school".  I'd much prefer not to get it, and have this funny idea that kids are a bit hard to handle when they want to run around at school.

@sidherian @AugersMonster @RageSheen So now you get to watch others repeat past mistakes

That is what a study of history equips you for isn’t it?

@AugersMonster @RageSheen @RichardfromSyd1 I should have studied science subjects in grades 11 & 12, gone to medical school, learned to drive, graduated, gotten good job in hospital & then been able to easily obtain vax for 1 in 100 yr plague. If only I’d been more sensible in 1979.

@RichardfromSyd1 So business lobby groups campaign against masks in workplaces, so we then use that as justification to get rid of masks in schools? The only setting that has compulsory full time attendance and duty of care to protect children? Who are largely unvaccinated?
